author: Marcia Bartusiak
title: ‘Chasing New Horizons’ and ‘Discovering Pluto’ Reviews: Big Lessons From a Tiny World
text:
With apologies to Shakespeare, I come to praise Pluto, not to bury it. Though this tiny solar-system body was demoted to dwarf planet in 2006 to the distress of many children (and adults), it’s time to dry your eyes and put away the handkerchiefs. Two books about NASA’s recent New Horizons mission demonstrate Pluto’s continuing importance in planetary studies.
One particular photo fired up the public’s imagination during the spacecraft’s flyby in July 2015. The image captured a bright white region on Pluto’s surface in the...
